snippet: The procedures require that collection cases brought to court must be accompanied by proper documentation of each debt’s origin, history and amount.
abstract: New York State court system adopts new rules intended to protect people in debt and make it harder for debt collection companies to win default judgements; New York courts hear more than 100,000 credit card collection cases each year, many from third-party debt buyers that have come under criticism from consumer advocates.
lead_paragraph: The procedures require that collection cases brought to court must be accompanied by proper documentation of each debt’s origin, history and amount.

headline.main: New York State Judiciary Adopts Rules to Protect Debtors
headline.print_headline: State Courts Adopt Rules to Safeguard Those in Debt
